intro: Pitcairnia ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow-leaved pitcairnia, is a species of flowering plant in the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. This plant is characterized by its striking yellow bracts that surround the inflorescence, giving it a vibrant appearance. It typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
